column5: July in Cuba is not my first choice for a summer vacation, but it was my sister inlaw's wedding, and usually I know where to pick my battles.   The trip was great. I was concerned about flying with a 6 month old because I didn't want to be one of those people with the crying baby on the plane. Ryan was a better flyer then I am, mostly because he has more patients with idiots then I.  40 plus Celsius and humid every day, but the air conditioning in the room worked, the pool was close and the drinks were cold.  I took a pack rod as as few lures as I've ever brought on a trip. I went for a long, hot walk down the highway in Varadaro to an area that looked promising on the bus ride into the resort. No luck.  Here are some photos from the trip:            I'd like to go back, but it will be in January or February for this Canuck.
you can line up a photo!!!  great pics!!
Amazing photos as usual Rob, thanks for sharing...  Maureen
The fishing's generally much better in winter, when the water cools down and only feels like soup.
Oh my goodness!!!... the poor little Canuck sweated!  Excellent pics Rob!!!... I really like the Blue/Green Anole (lizard)

Great pics Rob.  LOL...i have to laugh...cuz i know exactly what you mean about not wanting to be the person on a plane with screaming baby...we are doing our first trip on a plane with the baby in 2 weeks....dreading it really.

Great shots!!  Was in Varadero a few years ago and it was awesome...  The pic of that green anole brought back a lot of memories!!  I had kept a few in the room as pets and the maids refused to clean our room for the entire week!!  cheers HD
Sure, it was the lizards that kept the maids from going into your room.
iberostar??  Was there in Feb-great place. Nowhere to fish really. THE best resort in Varadero.
That's the one. There were a few spots that looked promising on the way in, but I really didn't have the time to explore them properly.
